{"step_by_step_thinking": "Intestinal malabsorption refers to any condition in which the absorption of nutrients in the small intestine is impaired. Fecal fat estimation is a test that measures the body's ability to break down and absorb fat. It is a direct measure of fat malabsorption. Serum lactose levels are not a direct measure of malabsorption, they can indicate lactose intolerance but not necessarily malabsorption. Serum amylase levels are more related to pancreatic function and not directly related to intestinal absorption. The NBT-PABA test is a measure of pancreatic exocrine function and not directly related to intestinal absorption.", "answer_choice": "A"}
